alert.note: Alert for Latimer; Pittsburg; Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 12 at 12:56AM CDT until May 12 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN PUSHMATAHA...WESTERN LATIMER AND EASTERN PITTSBURG COUNTIES... At 1256 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Arrowhead State Park to 3 miles southwest of Damon to 8 miles northwest of Stanley, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations in or near the path include... Wilburton... Arrowhead State Park... Damon... Blocker... Yanush... Robbers Cave State Park... Sardis... Featherston... THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for southeastern Oklahoma. A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure, such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
